content.rendered:
When in Miami, beaches aren’t the only place to explore. Apart from the incredible nightlife, Miami boasts a colorful art scene, an incredible mix of culture, and some famous historical landmarks such as the Freedom Tower which once served as a reception center for Cuban refugees. Meanwhile, Barnacle Historic State Park is home to the oldest house in Miami (and some incredible views). Read on to learn more about the best things to do in Miami, and explore the city with brand new eyes!

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Miami

Outdoors in Miami

1. Explore Oleta State Park

Miami may not have mountains, but the running and mountain biking trails at the Oleta State Park make up for it. You can also take part in paddle activities in protected Mangrove areas!

  • Costs: Free for children under 6. Prices then range from $1 to $10 depending on the vehicle, number of people, and the time of the day.
  • Timings: 8 AM to sundown. Reservations are required for overnight stays.
Website

2. Visit the dog-friendly Hobie Beach

If you want your furry friend to enjoy a trip to Miami alongside you, then visiting Hobie Beach is definitely one of the best things to do in Miami. Wade in the shallow waters with your pup, and watch the sun go down for a relaxing end to your day.

  • Costs: Entry is free
  • Timings: 6:30 AM to 8 PM daily
Learn More

3. Enjoy the fresh air at David T. Kennedy Park

From picnic tables to biking trails, you will find it all in David T. Kennedy Park. One of the best places to visit in Miami if you want to relax outdoors with a picnic, or take a walk with your dog.

  • Costs: Entry is free
  • Timings: Sunrise to Sunset
Directions

4. Admire the beauty of the Venetian Pool

Venetian Pool isn’t a plain old water park that you would find in any other city. In fact, it is an almost century-old wonder. Created from a coral rock quarry in 1923, the Venetian Pool is famous across the globe for its beautiful views, waterfalls, and cave-like grottos.

  • Costs: Vary per season
  • Timings: Vary per month
Learn More

Sports in Miami

1. Catch a Miami HEATS game!

If you’re a sports fanatic, you cannot miss out on a Miami HEATS game at the American Airlines Arena. This team reigns supreme when you talk about sports in the city, so attending a game here is surely one of the best things to do in Miami, whether you’re a visitor or a local.

  • Costs: Start at $76
  • Timings: Vary as per game season
Learn More

2. Miami Dolphins – the oldest sports franchise in Miami

Head to the recently renovated Hard Rock Stadium to catch the Miami Dolphins at play. The American football games played here are always action-packed and exciting to watch!

  • Costs: start at $84
  • Timings: Vary per game season.
Learn More

Museums in Miami

1. Marvel at the architectural beauty of the Perez Art Museum Miami

The Perez Art Museum Miami is one of the best places to visit in Miami, not only for those with an appreciation for art, but also for those who like to admire unique architecture. With rounded walls and hanging gardens, the building is truly worthy of being called an Art Museum!

  • Costs: Adults: $16; Seniors, Students with ID, Youth (7-18): $12; Active US Military & Veterans, Florida Educator, Healthcare Professionals and First Respondents (with ID), Children below 7: Free; discount available for Members.
  • Timings: Thursday: 2 PM to 9 PM; Friday to Sunday: 11 AM to 6 PM; Reservation is required due to limited capacity.
Website

2. Learn about the history of the city at HistoryMiami

Learn everything there is to know about the city, from Hurricane Andrew to the people who helped bring this wonderful city to the limelight. HistoryMiami also arranges frequent walking tours with the eminent Miami historian, Paul George, which is undoubtedly one of the best things to do in Miami!

  • Costs: Adults: $10; Seniors: $8; Children (6-12): $5; Free for Military members and children under 6
  • Timings: Monday to Saturday: 10 AM to 5 PM. Sunday: 12 PM to 5 PM.
Learn More

3. Be mesmerized by intriguing designs at the Institute of Contemporary Art

Located in the Design District of Miami, the Institute of Contemporary art not only showcases the work of contemporary artists in the city, but it also facilitates education and art research. From art installations that fill the room to unique sculptures and stunning photography, the exhibitions in this museum are ever-changing.

  • Costs: Entry is free but tickets are required due to limited capacity
  • Timings: Tuesdays to Saturdays: 11 AM to 6 PM. Sunday 12 PM to 5 PM.
Tickets

4. Explore the beautiful Morikami Museum and Gardens

At Morikami Museum and Gardens you can walk through Japanese gardens from different eras, and even catch a glimpse of sculpted bonsai trees and lanterns. The inner buildings also feature rotating exhibitions of Japanese artwork.

  • Costs: Adults: $15; Seniors and Military: $13; Students with ID: $11; Children 6-17: $9, Children under 6: Free.
  • Timings: Tuesday to Sunday: 10 Am to 5 PM
Learn More

Culture in Miami

1. Explore the Bill Baggs Cape Florida State Park

Climb to the top of the lighthouse for an amazing view of Miami at Bill Baggs Cape Florida State Park. And if you’d like a unique way to explore the park or you simply don’t fancy the walk, consider hopping on one of the quad bike rentals for a fun way to explore the sights!

  • Costs: $8 per vehicle
  • Timings: 8 AM to sunset
Learn More

2. Join the Miami Ecoadventures

Fishing, kayaking, canoeing, and more – there’s a lot to do at Miami Ecoadventures. This nature-filled outdoor adventure program is fun for all ages, with specially curated activities for children as well.

  • Costs: Vary per event
  • Timings: Vary per event
Learn More

3. Explore the best biking trails at Historic Virginia Key Beach Park

From novice trails to rugged mountain biking routes, you will find it all at the Historic Virginia Key Beach Park. With new additions added every once in a while, this is definitely one of the best things to do in Miami if you love cycling or would like to give it a try!

  • Costs: $8 per vehicle, $15 for buses
  • Timings: 7 AM to Sunset
Learn More

Restaurants in Miami

1. Dine-in at Carbone

The food here is not only Instagram-worthy but absolutely mouthwateringly good as well. As one of the most popular restaurants in Miami, Carbone serves delicious Italian cuisine and offers a luxurious experience. You can even enjoy cocktails with your meal if you wish!

  • Costs: Entrees start at $40
  • Timings: Reservation only
Official Website

2. Visit Osteria Morini, a restaurant founded by Michelin-starred Chefs

Serving some rare and delicious Italian cuisine, Osteria Morini has been referred to as one of the finest Italian restaurants in Miami and the US as a whole. From their signature fresh pasta dishes to grilled meats and scrumptious seafood, there’s something for every taste here.

  • Costs: Entrees start at $38
  • Timings: Sunday – Thursday: 6:00 PM – 9:45 PM. Friday & Saturday: 6:00 PM – 10:45 PM.
Website

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find the best things to do in Miami? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we’ll help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
